cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 335 mi S of Panama City, FL
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north in the eastern Gulf, then turning northeast across the southeastern U.S. and exiting off the Mid-Atlantic/New England coast late Friday into Saturday.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Chassahowitzka FL to Anna Maria Island FL (incl. Tampa Bay); MS/AL border to Mouth of Pearl River; Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane: AL/FL border to Suwannee River FL.  Tropical-Storm: AL/FL border to MS/AL border and Suwannee River to Chassahowitzka FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast, southeastern U.S., Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic and New England coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 kt) possible Friday into early Saturday as Michael’s remnants pass nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; track passes inland then offshore well north of Boston before significant surge can develop.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday–Saturday, creating localized ponding and minor flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous rip currents along the Massachusetts coast; brief marine gale conditions possible.
